00046 template<typename KeyType, typename ValueType=NullType, typename LockType=NullLock, typename Alloc=std::allocator<DataType<KeyType,ValueType> > >class BTreeFile

00081         void setPageSize(size_t maxDataSize) {
00082                 _pageSize = sizeof(byte); //leafFlag
00083                 _pageSize += sizeof(size_t); // object count
00084 
00085                 _pageSize += (_minDegree * 2 - 1) * (sizeof(size_t) + maxDataSize
00086                                 + sizeof(long) + sizeof(byte) ); // records + overflow address
00087                 _pageSize += _minDegree * 2 * sizeof(long); // child locations          
00088                 _maxDataSize = maxDataSize;
00089 
00090                 BTreeNode<KeyType, DataType, LockType, Alloc>::setDataSize(maxDataSize,
00091                                 _pageSize, _overFlowSize);
00092 
00093                 //_pageSize += BOOST_SERIAZLIZATION_HEAD_LENGTH;
00094         }
00095

00109                 _cacheSize = 2*sz/_minDegree;
00110         }

00131         bool close() {
00132                 //note that _root can be  NULL, if no items.
00133                 flush();
00134                 if (_root) {
00135                         _root->unload();
00136                         _root.reset(0);
00137                 }
00138 
00139                 if (_dataFile != 0) {
00140                         fclose(_dataFile);
00141                         _dataFile = 0;
00142                 }
00143                 return true;
00144         }

00288         void commit() {
00289                 //write back the fileHead
00290                 if(_root)
00291                 sfh.rootPos = _root->fpos;
00292                 sfh.numItem = _numItem;
00293                 sfh.pageSize = _pageSize;
00294 
00295                 if( !_dataFile )return;
00296 
00297                 if ( 0 != fseek(_dataFile, 0, SEEK_SET)) {
00298                         abort();
00299                 }
00300                 if (1 != fwrite(&sfh, sizeof(sfh), 1, _dataFile)) {
00301                         abort();
00302                 }
00303 
00304                 _flush(_root, _dataFile);
00305 
00306                 /*while( !_dirtyPages.empty() )
00307                  {
00308                  BTreeNodePtr ptr = _dirtyPages.back();
00309                  _dirtyPages.pop_back();
00310                  ptr->write(_dataFile);
00311                  }*/
00312                 fflush(_dataFile);
00313 
00314         }

00329         KeyType getNearest(const KeyType& key) {
00330 
00331                 BTreeNodePtr node = _root;
00332                 OBJECTPOS op;
00333                 SDBCursor locn;
00334                 DataType dat;
00335 
00336                 while (true) {
00337                         op = node->findPos1(key);
00338 
00339                         switch (op.second) {
00340                                 case ECP_NONE:
00341                                 return KeyType();
00342                                 break;
00343                                 case ECP_INTHIS:
00344                                 return node->elements[op.first]->pdat->get_key();
00345                                 break;
00346 
00347                                 case ECP_INLEFT:
00348                                 node = node->loadChild(op.first, _dataFile);
00349                                 break;
00350 
00351                                 case ECP_INRIGHT:
00352                                 node = node->loadChild(op.first + 1, _dataFile);
00353                                 break;
00354 
00355                                 case ECP_NEARLEFT:
00356                                 return node->elements[op.first]->pdat->get_key();
00357                                 break;
00358 
00359                                 case ECP_NEARRIGHT:
00360                                 locn.first = node;
00361                                 locn.second = op.first;
00362                                 if (seq(locn, dat) ) {
00363                                         return dat.get_key();
00364                                 } else {
00365                                         return node->elements[op.first]->pdat->get_key();
00366                                 }
00367                                 break;
00368 
00369                                 default:
00370                                 break;
00371                         }
00372 
00373                 }
00374         }

00387         }
00388 
00389         bool search(const KeyType& key, SDBCursor& locn) {
00390 
00391                 //do Flush, when there are too many active nodes.
00392                 _flushCache();
00393 
00394                 locn.first = BTreeNodePtr();
00395                 locn.second = (size_t)-1;
00396 
00397                 BTreeNodePtr temp = _root;
00398                 while (1) {
00399                         int ctr = temp->objCount;
00400                         int low = 0;
00401                         int high = ctr-1;
00402                         int compVal;
00403                         while (low <= high) {
00404                                 int mid = (low+high)/2;
00405                                 //cout<<"mid "<<mid<<endl;
00406                                 compVal = comp(key,temp->elements[mid]->pdat->get_key() );
00407                                 if (compVal == 0) {
00408                                         locn.first = temp;
00409                                         locn.second = mid;
00410                                         return true;
00411                                 }
00412                                 else if (compVal < 0)
00413                                 high = mid-1;
00414                                 else {
00415                                         low = mid+1;
00416                                 }
00417                         }
00418 
00419                         if (!temp->isLeaf) {
00420                                 temp = temp->loadChild(low, _dataFile);
00421                         } else {
00422                                 break;
00423                         }
00424                 }
00425                 return false;
00426         }

00479         void _flushCache() {
00480 
00481                 //cout<<bucket_chain::activeNum<<" vs "<<sfh_.cacheSize <<endl;
00482                 if( BTreeNode<KeyType, DataType, LockType, Alloc>::activeNodeNum> sfh.cacheSize )
00483                 {
00484                         //commit();
00485                         //_dirtyPages.clear();
00486 #ifdef  DEBUG
00487                         cout<<"cache is full..."<<endl;
00488                         cout<<BTreeNode<KeyType, DataType, LockType, Alloc>::activeNodeNum<<" vs "<<sfh.cacheSize <<endl;
00489 #endif
00490 
00491                         queue<BTreeNodePtr> qnode;
00492                         qnode.push(_root);
00493                         //_root->unload();
00494 
00495                         size_t popNum = 0;
00496                         while ( !qnode.empty() ) {
00497                                 BTreeNodePtr popNode = qnode.front();
00498                                 qnode.pop();
00499                                 popNum++;
00500                                 if(popNum >= sfh.cacheSize/_minDegree/2)
00501                                 {
00502                                         if(popNode->_isDirty)
00503                                         _flush(popNode, _dataFile);
00504                                         popNode->unload();
00505 
00506                                         //cout<<"unload....";
00507                                         //cout<<BTreeNode<KeyType, DataType, LockType, Alloc>::activeNodeNum<<" vs "<<sfh.cacheSize <<endl;
00508 
00509                                         if(BTreeNode<KeyType, DataType, LockType, Alloc>::activeNodeNum < sfh.cacheSize/2)
00510                                         {
00511                                                 break;
00512                                         }
00513                                 }
00514                                 if (!popNode->isLeaf) {
00515                                         for (BIT tnvit = popNode->children.begin(); tnvit
00516                                                         != popNode->children.end(); tnvit++) {
00517                                                 if (*tnvit)
00518                                                 qnode.push(*tnvit);
00519                                         }
00520 
00521                                 }
00522                                 popNode.reset(0);
00523                         }
00524                         //display();
00525 #ifdef DEBUG
00526                         cout<<"stop unload..."<<endl;
00527                         cout<<BTreeNode<KeyType, DataType, LockType, Alloc>::activeNodeNum<<" vs "<<sfh.cacheSize <<endl;
00528 #endif          
00529                 }
00530                 fflush(_dataFile);
00531 
00532         }
00533 
00534         void _flushCache1() {
00535                 commit();
00536                 //cout<<BTreeNode<KeyType, DataType, LockType, Alloc>::activeNodeNum <<" > "<<_cacheSize<<endl;
00537                 if (BTreeNode<KeyType, DataType, LockType, Alloc>::activeNodeNum> _cacheSize) {
00538 #ifdef DEBUG
00539                         // display();   
00540                         cout<<"flush ... "<<_cacheSize << endl;
00541                         cout<<"activeNode: " <<BTreeNode<KeyType, DataType, LockType, Alloc>::activeNodeNum
00542                         <<endl;
00543 #endif
00544                         _isUnload = true;
00545 
00546                         if ( _root && !_root->isLeaf) {
00547                                 for (size_t ctr = 0; ctr <= _root->objCount; ctr++) {
00548                                         // keep engough node in memory to impove the efficency.
00549                                         if (BTreeNode<KeyType, DataType, LockType, Alloc>::activeNodeNum
00550                                                         < _cacheSize/2 ) {
00551 #ifdef DEBUG
00552                                                 cout<<"AcitveNodeNum= "
00553                                                 <<BTreeNode<KeyType, DataType, LockType, Alloc>::activeNodeNum
00554                                                 <<"\n stop unload\n";
00555 #endif
00556 
00557                                                 break;
00558                                         }
00559 
00560                                         BTreeNodePtr pChild = _root->children[ctr];
00561                                         if ((BTreeNodePtr)pChild != 0) {
00562                                                 _root->children[ctr]->unload();
00563                                         }
00564                                         _isUnload = false;
00565 
00566                                 }
00567                         }
00568                         //display();
00569                 }
00570 
00571         }

00573         // internal data manipulation functions (see Cormen, Leiserson, Rivest).
00574         //      static inline int _defaultCompare(const DbObjPtr& obj1, const DbObjPtr& obj2);
00575         //      static int _searchCompare(const DbObjPtr& obj1, const DbObjPtr& obj2);
00576 
00577         BTreeNodePtr _allocateNode() {
00578 
00579                 BTreeNodePtr newNode;
00580                 newNode.reset(new BTreeNode<KeyType, DataType, LockType, Alloc>);
00581 
00582                 fseek(_dataFile, 0L, SEEK_END);
00583                 long len = ftell(_dataFile);
00584                 newNode->fpos = len;
00585 
00586                 newNode->loaded = true;
00587                 newNode->childNo = size_t(-1);
00588 
00589                 char *pBuf = new char[_pageSize];
00590                 memset(pBuf, 0, _pageSize);
00591 
00592                 fwrite(pBuf, sizeof(char), _pageSize, _dataFile);
00593 
00594                 delete [] pBuf;
00595 
00596                 return newNode;
00597 
00598                 /*      static int num;
00599                  BTreeNodePtr newNode;
00600                  newNode.reset(new BTreeNode<KeyType, DataType>);
00601 
00602                  newNode->fpos = _recOff + _pageSize*num++;
00603 
00604                  newNode->loaded = true;
00605 
00606                  newNode->childNo = size_t(-1);
00607 
00608                  return newNode;                */
00609         }

00611         void _split(BTreeNodePtr& parent, size_t childNum, BTreeNodePtr& child);
00612         BTreeNodePtr _merge(BTreeNodePtr& parent, size_t objNo) {
00613 
00614                 size_t ctr = 0;
00615 
00616                 BTreeNodePtr c1 = parent->loadChild(objNo, _dataFile);
00617                 BTreeNodePtr c2 = parent->loadChild(objNo+1, _dataFile);
00618 
00619                 c1->elements.resize(2 * _minDegree - 1);
00620                 for (ctr = 0; ctr < _minDegree - 1; ctr++) {
00621                         c1->elements[_minDegree + ctr] = c2->elements[ctr];
00622                 }
00623                 if (!c2->isLeaf) {
00624                         c1->children.resize(2 * _minDegree);
00625                         for (ctr = 0; ctr < _minDegree; ctr++) {
00626                                 size_t newPos = _minDegree + ctr;
00627 
00628                                 c2->loadChild(ctr, _dataFile);
00629                                 c1->children[newPos] = c2->children[ctr];
00630                                 c1->children[newPos]->childNo = newPos;
00631                                 c1->children[newPos] ->parent = c1;//wps add it!                                
00632                         }
00633                 }
00634 
00635                 // Put the parent into the middle
00636                 c1->elements[_minDegree - 1] = parent->elements[objNo];
00637                 c1->objCount = 2 * _minDegree - 1;
00638 
00639                 // Reshuffle the parent (it has one less object/child)
00640                 for (ctr = objNo + 1; ctr < parent->objCount; ctr++) {
00641                         parent->elements[ctr - 1] = parent->elements[ctr];
00642                         parent->loadChild(ctr+1, _dataFile);
00643                         parent->children[ctr] = parent->children[ctr + 1];
00644                         parent->children[ctr]->childNo = ctr;
00645                 }
00646                 --parent->objCount;
00647                 parent->elements.resize(parent->objCount);
00648                 parent->children.resize(parent->objCount + 1);
00649 
00650                 if (parent->objCount == 0)//wps add it! 
00651                 {
00652                         parent = c1;
00653                 }
00654 
00655                 // Write the two affected nodes to the disk. Note that
00656                 // c2 just goes away. The node will be deallocated because
00657                 // of the smart pointers, and the node's location on
00658                 // disk will become inaccessible. This will have to be
00659                 // fixed by the judicious use of the compact() method.
00660 
00661                 //c1->write(_dataFile);
00662                 //parent->write(_dataFile);
00663 
00664                 c1->setDirty(1);
00665                 parent->setDirty(_dataFile);
00666 
00667                 //_dirtyPages.push_back(c1);
00668                 //_dirtyPages.push_back(parent);
00669 
00670                 // Return a pointer to the new child.
00671                 return c1;
00672         }

00679 
00680         // Finds the location of the predecessor of this key, given
00681         // the root of the subtree to search. The predecessor is going
00682         // to be the right-most object in the right-most leaf node.
00683         SDBCursor _findPred(BTreeNodePtr& node) {
00684                 SDBCursor ret(BTreeNodePtr(), (size_t)-1);
00685                 BTreeNodePtr child = node;
00686                 while (!child->isLeaf) {
00687                         child = child->loadChild(child->objCount, _dataFile);
00688                 }
00689                 ret.first = child;
00690                 ret.second = child->objCount - 1;
00691                 return ret;
00692         }
00693 
00694         // Finds the location of the successor of this key, given
00695         // the root of the subtree to search. The successor is the
00696         // left-most object in the left-most leaf node.
00697         SDBCursor _findSucc(BTreeNodePtr& node) {
00698                 SDBCursor ret(BTreeNodePtr(), (size_t)-1);
00699                 BTreeNodePtr child = node;
00700                 while (!child->isLeaf) {
00701                         child = child->loadChild(0, _dataFile);
00702                 }
00703                 ret.first = child;
00704                 ret.second = 0;
00705                 return ret;
00706         }

00709 
00710 // The constructor simply sets up the different data members, and if
00711 // the caller doesn't provide a compare function of their own, specifies
00712 // the default comparison function.
00713 template<typename KeyType, typename ValueType, typename LockType,
00714                 typename Alloc> BTreeFile< KeyType, ValueType, LockType, Alloc>::BTreeFile(
00715                 const std::string& fileName) :
00716         _fileName(fileName), _dataFile(0), _numItem(0) {
00717         _minDegree = 16;
00718 
00719         _maxDataSize = 64;
00720         setPageSize(_maxDataSize);
00721 
00722         _overFlowSize = 1024;
00723         _cacheSize = 1000000; //default set 1000000     
00724 
00725         _isUnload = false;
00726         _root = 0;
00727 }
00728 
00729 // The destructor of a BTreeFile object unloads the root
00730 // node and then assigns null to the _root smart pointer.
00731 // This deletes the item that was already there.
00732 // Unloading the root node ensures that there are no
00733 // children floating around referring to the root node, so
00734 // that when we come to assign null to the smart pointer,
00735 // the number of references will drop to zero, and the
00736 // actual node will be deleted.
00737 // We also have to close the file.
00738 template<typename KeyType, typename ValueType, typename LockType,
00739                 typename Alloc> BTreeFile< KeyType, ValueType, LockType, Alloc>::~BTreeFile() {
00740         close();
00741 }
00742 
00743 // Splits a child node, creating a new node. The median value from the
00744 // full child is moved into the *non-full* parent. The keys above the
00745 // median are moved from the full child to the new child.
00746 template<typename KeyType, typename ValueType, typename LockType,
00747                 typename Alloc> void BTreeFile< KeyType, ValueType, LockType, Alloc>::_split(
00748                 BTreeNodePtr& parent, size_t childNum, BTreeNodePtr& child) {
00749 
00750         //cout<<"splitting"<<endl;
00751         size_t ctr = 0;
00752         DataTypePtr saveObj;
00753         BTreeNodePtr newChild = _allocateNode();
00754         newChild->isLeaf = child->isLeaf;
00755         newChild->setCount(_minDegree - 1);
00756 
00757         // Put the high values in the new child, then shrink the existing child.
00758         for (ctr = 0; ctr < _minDegree - 1; ctr++) {
00759                 newChild->elements[ctr] = child->elements[_minDegree + ctr];
00760         }
00761         if (!child->isLeaf) {
00762                 for (ctr = 0; ctr < _minDegree; ctr++) {
00763                         BTreeNodePtr mover = child->children[_minDegree + ctr];
00764                         newChild->children[ctr] = mover;
00765                         mover->childNo = ctr;
00766                         mover->parent = newChild;
00767                 }
00768         }
00769         saveObj = child->elements[_minDegree - 1];
00770         child->setCount(_minDegree - 1);
00771 
00772         // Move the child pointers above childNum up in the parent
00773         parent->setCount(parent->objCount + 1);
00774         for (ctr = parent->objCount; ctr> childNum + 1; ctr--) {
00775                 parent->children[ctr] = parent->children[ctr - 1];
00776                 parent->children[ctr]->childNo = ctr;
00777         }
00778         parent->children[childNum + 1] = newChild;
00779         newChild->childNo = childNum + 1;
00780         newChild->parent = parent;
00781         for (ctr = parent->objCount - 1; ctr> childNum; ctr--) {
00782                 parent->elements[ctr] = parent->elements[ctr - 1];
00783         }
00784         parent->elements[childNum] = saveObj;
00785 
00786         child->setDirty(1);
00787         newChild->setDirty(1);
00788         parent->setDirty(1);
00789 
00790         //_dirtyPages.push_back(child);
00791         //_dirtyPages.push_back(newChild);
00792         //_dirtyPages.push_back(parent);
00793         //child->write(_dataFile);      
00794         //newChild->write(_dataFile);   
00795         //parent->write(_dataFile);
00796 }
00797 
00798 template<typename KeyType, typename ValueType, typename LockType,
00799                 typename Alloc> bool BTreeFile< KeyType, ValueType, LockType, Alloc>::_insert(
00800                 const DataType& dat) {
00801 
00802         KeyType key = dat.get_key();
00803 
00804         if (_root->objCount == _minDegree *2 - 1) {
00805                 // Growing the tree happens by creating a new
00806                 // node as the new root, and splitting the
00807                 // old root into a pair of children.
00808                 BTreeNodePtr oldRoot = _root;
00809 
00810                 _root = _allocateNode();
00811                 _root->setCount(0);
00812                 _root->isLeaf = false;
00813                 _root->children[0] = oldRoot;
00814                 oldRoot->childNo = 0;
00815                 oldRoot->parent = _root;
00816                 _split(_root, 0, oldRoot);
00817                 goto L0;
00818 
00819         } else {
00820                 L0: BTreeNodePtr node = _root;
00821                 L1: size_t ctr = node->objCount;
00822 
00823                 /*if (ctr == 0) {
00824                  node->setCount(1);
00825                  node->elements[0].reset(new PtrObj<DataType>(dat));
00826                  node->setDirty(1);
00827                  return true;
00828                  }*/
00829 
00830                 // If the node is a leaf, we just find the location to insert
00831                 // the new item, and shuffle everything else up.
00832                 if (node->isLeaf) {
00833                         int low = 0;
00834                         int high = ctr-1;
00835                         int compVal;
00836                         while (low<=high) {
00837                                 int mid = (low+high)/2;//cout<<"mid "<<mid<<endl;
00838                                 compVal = comp(key, node->elements[mid]->pdat->get_key());
00839                                 if (compVal == 0)
00840                                         return false;
00841                                 else if (compVal < 0)
00842                                         high = mid-1;
00843                                 else {
00844                                         low = mid+1;
00845                                 }
00846                         }
00847 
00848                         node->setCount(node->objCount + 1);
00849                         for (; (int)ctr> low; ctr--) {
00850                                 node->elements[ctr] = node->elements[ctr - 1];
00851                         }
00852 
00853                         node->elements[low].reset(new PtrObj<DataType, LockType, Alloc>(dat));
00854                         node->setDirty(1);
00855                         //_dirtyPages.push_back(node);
00856                         return true;
00857                 }
00858 
00859                 // If the node is an internal node, we need to find
00860                 // the location to insert the value ...
00861                 else {
00862                         int low = 0;
00863                         int high = ctr-1;
00864                         int compVal;
00865                         while (low<=high) {
00866                                 int mid = (low+high)/2;
00867                                 compVal = comp(key, node->elements[mid]->pdat->get_key());
00868                                 if (compVal == 0)
00869                                         return false;
00870                                 else if (compVal < 0)
00871                                         high = mid-1;
00872                                 else {
00873                                         low = mid+1;
00874                                 }
00875                         }
00876 
00877                         ctr = low;
00878                         // Load the child into which the value will be inserted.
00879                         BTreeNodePtr child = node->loadChild(ctr, _dataFile);
00880 
00881                         // If the child node is full (2t - 1 elements), then we need
00882                         // to split the node.
00883                         if (child->objCount == _minDegree *2 - 1) {
00884                                 _split(node, ctr, child);
00885                                 int compVal =comp(key, node->elements[ctr]->pdat->get_key() );
00886                                 //comp(key, node->elements[ctr]->pdat->get_key() );
00887                                 if (compVal == 0)
00888                                         return false;
00889                                 if (compVal> 0) {
00890                                         ++ctr;
00891                                 }
00892                                 child = node->children[ctr];
00893                         }
00894 
00895                         // Insert the key (recursively) into the non-full child
00896                         // node.
00897                         node = child;
00898                         goto L1;
00899                         //_insertNonFull(child, dat);
00900                 }
00901         }
00902 }
00903 
00904 // Write all nodes in the tree to the file given.
00905 template<typename KeyType, typename ValueType, typename LockType,
00906                 typename Alloc> void BTreeFile< KeyType, ValueType, LockType, Alloc>::_flush(
00907                 BTreeNodePtr& node, FILE* f) {
00908 
00909         // Bug out if the file is not valid
00910         if (!f) {
00911                 return;
00912         }
00913         queue<BTreeNodePtr> qnode;
00914         qnode.push(node);
00915         while (!qnode.empty()) {
00916                 BTreeNodePtr popNode = qnode.front();
00917                 if (popNode->loaded) {
00918                         popNode->write(f);
00919                 }
00920                 qnode.pop();
00921                 if (!popNode->isLeaf) {
00922                         for (BIT tnvit = popNode->children.begin(); tnvit
00923                                         != popNode->children.end(); tnvit++) {
00924                                 if (*tnvit)
00925                                         qnode.push(*tnvit);
00926                         }
00927 
00928                 }
00929                 popNode.reset(0);
00930         }
00931 
00932 }
00933 
00934 // Internal delete function, used once we've identified the
00935 // location of the node from which a key is to be deleted.
00936 template<typename KeyType, typename ValueType, typename LockType,
00937                 typename Alloc> bool BTreeFile< KeyType, ValueType, LockType, Alloc>::_delete(
00938                 BTreeNodePtr& nd, const KeyType& k) {
00939         bool ret = false;
00940 
00941         // Find the object position. op will have the position
00942         // of the object in op.first, and a flag (op.second)
00943         // saying whether the object at op.first is an exact
00944         // match (true) or if the object is in a child of the
00945         // current node (false). If op.first is -1, the object
00946         // is neither in this node, or a child node.    
00947 
00948         BTreeNodePtr node = nd;
00949         KeyType key = k;
00950 
00951         L0: OBJECTPOS op = node->findPos(key);
00952 
00953         if (op.first != (size_t)-1) // it's in there somewhere ...
00954         {
00955 
00956                 if (op.second == ECP_INTHIS) // we've got an exact match
00957                 {
00958                         // Case 1: deletion from leaf node.
00959                         if (node->isLeaf) {
00960                                 node->delFromLeaf(op.first);
00961 
00962                                 //now node is dirty
00963                                 node->setDirty(1);
00964                                 //_dirtyPages.push_back(node);
00965                                 ret = true;
00966                         }
00967                         // Case 2: Exact match on internal leaf.
00968                         else {
00969                                 // Case 2a: prior child has enough elements to pull one out.
00970                                 node->loadChild(op.first, _dataFile);
00971                                 node->loadChild(op.first+1, _dataFile);
00972                                 if (node->children[op.first]->objCount >= _minDegree) {
00973                                         BTreeNodePtr childNode = node->loadChild(op.first,
00974                                                         _dataFile);
00975                                         SDBCursor locn = _findPred(childNode);
00976 
00977                                         DataType dat = *(locn.first->elements[locn.second]->pdat);
00978                                         DataTypePtr pdat;
00979                                         pdat.reset(new PtrObj<DataType, LockType, Alloc>(dat));
00980                                         node->elements[op.first] = pdat;
00981 
00982                                         //now node is dirty
00983                                         node->setDirty(1);
00984                                         //_dirtyPages.push_back(node);
00985 
00986                                         node = childNode;
00987                                         key = dat.get_key();
00988                                         goto L0;
00989                                         //ret = _delete(childNode, dat.get_key());
00990                                 }
00991 
00992                                 // Case 2b: successor child has enough elements to pull one out.
00993                                 else if (node->children[op.first + 1]->objCount >= _minDegree) {
00994                                         BTreeNodePtr childNode = node->loadChild(op.first + 1,
00995                                                         _dataFile);
00996                                         SDBCursor locn = _findSucc(childNode);
00997                                         DataType dat = *(locn.first->elements[locn.second]->pdat);
00998                                         DataTypePtr pdat;
00999                                         pdat.reset(new PtrObj<DataType, LockType, Alloc>(dat));
01000                                         node->elements[op.first] = pdat;
01001 
01002                                         //now node is dirty
01003                                         node->setDirty(1);
01004                                         //_dirtyPages.push_back(node);
01005 
01006                                         node = childNode;
01007                                         key = dat.get_key();
01008                                         goto L0;
01009                                         //ret = _delete(childNode, dat.get_key());
01010                                 }
01011 
01012                                 // Case 2c: both children have only t-1 elements.
01013                                 // Merge the two children, putting the key into the
01014                                 // new child. Then delete from the new child.
01015                                 else {
01016                                         BTreeNodePtr mergedChild = _merge(node, op.first);
01017                                         node = mergedChild;
01018                                         goto L0;
01019                                         //ret = _delete(mergedChild, key);
01020                                 }
01021                         }
01022                 }
01023 
01024                 // Case 3: key is not in the internal node being examined,
01025                 // but is in one of the children.
01026                 else if (op.second == ECP_INLEFT || op.second == ECP_INRIGHT) {
01027                         // Find out if the child tree containing the key
01028                         // has enough elements. If so, we just recurse into
01029                         // that child.
01030 
01031                         node->loadChild(op.first, _dataFile);
01032                         if (op.first+1<=node->objCount)
01033                                 node->loadChild(op.first+1, _dataFile);
01034                         size_t keyChildPos = (op.second == ECP_INLEFT) ? op.first
01035                                         : op.first + 1;
01036                         BTreeNodePtr childNode = node->loadChild(keyChildPos, _dataFile);
01037                         if (childNode->objCount >= _minDegree) {
01038                                 node = childNode;
01039                                 goto L0;
01040                                 //ret = _delete(childNode, key);
01041                         } else {
01042                                 // Find out if the childNode has an immediate
01043                                 // sibling with _minDegree keys.
01044                                 BTreeNodePtr leftSib;
01045                                 BTreeNodePtr rightSib;
01046                                 size_t leftCount = 0;
01047                                 size_t rightCount = 0;
01048                                 if (keyChildPos> 0) {
01049                                         leftSib = node->loadChild(keyChildPos - 1, _dataFile);
01050                                         leftCount = leftSib->objCount;
01051                                 }
01052                                 if (keyChildPos < node->objCount) {
01053                                         rightSib = node->loadChild(keyChildPos + 1, _dataFile);
01054                                         rightCount = rightSib->objCount;
01055                                 }
01056 
01057                                 // Case 3a: There is a sibling with _minDegree or more keys.
01058                                 if (leftCount >= _minDegree || rightCount >= _minDegree) {
01059                                         // Part of this process is making sure that the
01060                                         // child node has minDegree elements.
01061                                         childNode->setCount(_minDegree);
01062 
01063                                         // Bringing the new key from the left sibling
01064                                         if (leftCount >= _minDegree) {
01065                                                 // Shuffle the keys and elements up
01066                                                 size_t ctr = _minDegree - 1;
01067                                                 for (; ctr> 0; ctr--) {
01068                                                         childNode->elements[ctr]
01069                                                                         = childNode->elements[ctr - 1];
01070                                                         childNode->children[ctr + 1]
01071                                                                         = childNode->children[ctr];
01072                                                         if (childNode->children[ctr + 1]) {
01073                                                                 childNode->children[ctr + 1]->childNo = ctr + 1;
01074                                                         }
01075                                                 }
01076                                                 childNode->children[ctr + 1] = childNode->children[ctr];
01077                                                 if (childNode->children[ctr + 1]) {
01078                                                         childNode->children[ctr + 1]->childNo = ctr +1;
01079                                                 }//wps add it!
01080 
01081                                                 // Put the key from the parent into the empty space,
01082                                                 // pull the replacement key from the sibling, and
01083                                                 // move the appropriate child from the sibling to
01084                                                 // the target child.
01085                                                 childNode->elements[0]
01086                                                                 = node->elements[keyChildPos - 1];
01087                                                 node->elements[keyChildPos - 1]
01088                                                                 = leftSib->elements[leftSib->objCount - 1];
01089                                                 leftSib->elements.resize(leftSib->objCount - 1);
01090                                                 if (!leftSib->isLeaf) {
01091                                                         childNode->children[0]
01092                                                                         = leftSib->children[leftSib->objCount];
01093                                                         leftSib->children.resize(leftSib->objCount);
01094 
01095                                                         childNode->children[0]->childNo = 0;//wps add it
01096                                                         childNode->children[0]->parent = childNode;//wps add it
01097                                                 }
01098                                                 --leftSib->objCount;
01099 
01100                                                 //now node is dirty
01101                                                 leftSib->setDirty(1);
01102                                                 node->setDirty(1);
01103                                                 //_dirtyPages.push_back(leftSib);
01104                                                 //_dirtyPages.push_back(node);
01105                                         }
01106 
01107                                         // Bringing a new key in from the right sibling
01108                                         else {
01109                                                 // Put the key from the parent into the child,
01110                                                 // put the key from the sibling into the parent,
01111                                                 // and move the appropriate child from the
01112                                                 // sibling to the target child node.
01113                                                 childNode->elements[childNode->objCount - 1]
01114                                                                 = node->elements[op.first];
01115                                                 node->elements[op.first] = rightSib->elements[0];
01116                                                 if (!rightSib->isLeaf) {
01117                                                         childNode->children[childNode->objCount]
01118                                                                         = rightSib->children[0];
01119 
01120                                                         childNode->children[childNode->objCount]->childNo
01121                                                                         = childNode->objCount;//wps add it!
01122                                                         childNode->children[childNode->objCount]->parent
01123                                                                         = childNode;//wps add it!
01124                                                 }
01125 
01126                                                 // Now clean up the right node, shuffling keys
01127                                                 // and elements to the left and resizing.
01128                                                 size_t ctr = 0;
01129                                                 for (; ctr < rightSib->objCount - 1; ctr++) {
01130                                                         rightSib->elements[ctr]
01131                                                                         = rightSib->elements[ctr + 1];
01132                                                         if (!rightSib->isLeaf) {
01133                                                                 rightSib->children[ctr]
01134                                                                                 = rightSib->children[ctr + 1];
01135 
01136                                                                 rightSib->children[ctr]->childNo = ctr;
01137                                                         }
01138                                                 }
01139                                                 if (!rightSib->isLeaf) {
01140                                                         rightSib->children[ctr]
01141                                                                         = rightSib->children[ctr + 1];
01142                                                         rightSib->children[ctr]->childNo = ctr;
01143                                                 }
01144                                                 rightSib->setCount(rightSib->objCount - 1);
01145 
01146                                                 //now node is dirty
01147                                                 rightSib->setDirty(true);
01148                                                 node->setDirty(1);
01149                                                 //_dirtyPages.push_back(rightSib);
01150                                                 //_dirtyPages.push_back(node);
01151                                         }
01152                                         node = childNode;
01153 
01154                                         node->setDirty(true);
01155                                         //_dirtyPages.push_back(node);
01156                                         goto L0;
01157                                         //ret = _delete(childNode, key);
01158                                 }
01159 
01160                                 // Case 3b: All siblings have _minDegree - 1 keys
01161                                 else {
01162                                         BTreeNodePtr mergedChild = _merge(node, op.first);
01163                                         node = mergedChild;
01164                                         goto L0;
01165                                         //ret = _delete(mergedChild, key);
01166                                 }
01167                         }
01168                 }
01169         }
01170         return ret;
01171 }
01172 
01173 // Opening the database means that we check the file
01174 // and see if it exists. If it doesn't exist, start a database
01175 // from scratch. If it does exist, load the root node into
01176 // memory.
01177 template<typename KeyType, typename ValueType, typename LockType,
01178                 typename Alloc> bool BTreeFile< KeyType, ValueType, LockType, Alloc>::open() {
01179         // We're creating if the file doesn't exist.
01180 
01181         struct stat statbuf;
01182         bool creating = stat(_fileName.c_str(), &statbuf);
01183 
01184         _dataFile = fopen(_fileName.c_str(), creating ? "w+b" : "r+b");
01185         if (0 == _dataFile) {
01186                 cout<<"SDB Error: open file failed, check if dat directory exists"
01187                                 <<endl;
01188                 return false;
01189         }
01190 
01191         // Create a new node
01192         bool ret = false;
01193         if (creating) {
01194 
01195                 if (_minDegree == size_t(-1) ) {
01196                         return false;
01197                 }
01198 
01199                 sfh.magic = 0x061561;
01200                 sfh.numItem = _numItem;
01201                 sfh.maxDataSize = _maxDataSize;
01202                 sfh.pageSize = _pageSize;
01203                 sfh.overFlowSize = _overFlowSize;
01204                 sfh.minDegree = _minDegree;
01205                 sfh.cacheSize = _cacheSize;
01206 
01207                 sfh.rootPos = sizeof(sfh);
01208 
01209 #ifdef DEBUG
01210                 cout<<"creating...\n"<<endl;
01211                 sfh.display();
01212 #endif
01213 
01214                 // when creating, write the node to the disk.
01215                 // remember that the first four bytes contain
01216                 // the address of the root node.
01217                 if (1 != fwrite(&sfh, sizeof(sfh), 1, _dataFile)) {
01218                         return false;
01219                 }
01220 
01221                 // If creating, allocate a node instead of
01222                 // reading one.
01223                 _root = _allocateNode();
01224                 _root->isLeaf = true;
01225                 _root->loaded = true;
01226 
01227                 _root->write(_dataFile);
01228                 ret = true;
01229 
01230                 BTreeNode<KeyType, DataType, LockType, Alloc>::setDataSize(
01231                                 _maxDataSize, _pageSize, _overFlowSize);
01232 
01233         } else {
01234 
01235                 // when not creating, read the root node from the disk.
01236                 memset(&sfh, 0, sizeof(sfh));
01237                 if (1 != fread(&sfh, sizeof(sfh), 1, _dataFile)) {
01238                         return false;
01239                 } else {
01240 
01241                         if (sfh.magic != 0x061561) {
01242                                 cout<<"Error, read wrong file header\n"<<endl;
01243                                 return false;
01244                         }
01245 
01246                         _minDegree = sfh.minDegree;
01247                         _maxDataSize = sfh.maxDataSize;
01248                         _pageSize = sfh.pageSize;
01249                         _overFlowSize = sfh.overFlowSize;
01250                         _cacheSize = sfh.cacheSize;
01251                         _numItem = sfh.numItem;
01252 
01253 #ifdef DEBUG
01254                         cout<<"open exist...\n"<<endl;
01255                         sfh.display();
01256 #endif
01257 
01258                         BTreeNode<KeyType, DataType, LockType, Alloc>::setDataSize(
01259                                         _maxDataSize, _pageSize, _overFlowSize);
01260 
01261                         _root.reset(new BTreeNode<KeyType, DataType, LockType, Alloc>);
01262                         _root->fpos = sfh.rootPos;
01263                         _root->read(_dataFile);
01264                         //_root->display();
01265                         ret = true;
01266 
01267                 }
01268                 // If note creating, just create and read
01269                 // rather than allocating.
01270         }
01271 
01272         return ret;
01273 }
01274 
01275 // This is the external delete function.
01276 template<typename KeyType, typename ValueType, typename LockType,
01277                 typename Alloc> bool BTreeFile< KeyType, ValueType, LockType, Alloc>::del(
01278                 const KeyType& key) {
01279         // Determine if the root node is empty.
01280         bool ret = (_root->objCount != 0);
01281 
01282         if (_root->objCount == (size_t) -1) {
01283                 return 0;
01284         }
01285 
01286         // If our root is not empty, call the internal
01287         // delete method on it.
01288         ret = ret && _delete(_root, key);
01289 
01290         // If we successfully deleted the key, and there
01291         // is nothing left in the root node and the root
01292         // node is not a leaf, we need to shrink the tree
01293         // by making the root's child (there should only
01294         // be one) the new root. Write the location of
01295         // the new root to the start of the file so we
01296         // know where to look.
01297         if (_root->objCount == 0 && !_root->isLeaf) {
01298                 _root = _root->children[0];
01299                 fseek(_dataFile, 0, SEEK_SET);
01300                 fwrite(&_root->fpos, sizeof(_root->fpos), 1, _dataFile);
01301         }
01302         if (ret)
01303                 _numItem--;
01304         return ret;
01305 }
01306 
01307 // External put method. This will overwrite a key
01308 // (allowing no duplicates) or insert a new item.
01309 template<typename KeyType, typename ValueType, typename LockType,
01310                 typename Alloc> bool BTreeFile< KeyType, ValueType, LockType, Alloc>::insert(
01311                 const DataType& rec) {
01312         _flushCache();
01313         if (_insert(rec) ) {
01314                 _numItem++;
01315                 return true;
01316         } else {
01317                 return false;
01318         }
01319 }
01320 
01321 // This method retrieves a record from the database
01322 // given its location.
01323 template<typename KeyType, typename ValueType, typename LockType,
01324                 typename Alloc> bool BTreeFile< KeyType, ValueType, LockType, Alloc>::get(
01325                 const SDBCursor& locn, DataType& rec) {
01326         if ((BTreeNodePtr)locn.first == 0 || locn.second == (size_t)-1) {
01327                 return false;
01328         }
01329         rec = *(locn.first->elements[locn.second]->pdat);
01330         return true;
01331 }
01332 
01333 // This method retrieves a record from the database
01334 // given its key.
01335 template<typename KeyType, typename ValueType, typename LockType,
01336                 typename Alloc> bool BTreeFile< KeyType, ValueType, LockType, Alloc>::get(
01337                 const KeyType& key, DataType& rec) {
01338         SDBCursor locn;
01339         search(key, locn);
01340         return get(locn, rec);
01341 }
01342 
01343 template<typename KeyType, typename ValueType, typename LockType,
01344                 typename Alloc> bool BTreeFile< KeyType, ValueType, LockType, Alloc>::update(
01345                 const DataType& rec) {
01346         SDBCursor locn(BTreeNodePtr(), (size_t)-1);
01347         //locn = search( rec.get_key() );
01348         search(rec.get_key(), locn);
01349         if (locn.second != (size_t) -1) {
01350                 locn.first->elements[locn.second].reset(new PtrObj<DataType, LockType, Alloc>(rec));
01351                 return true;
01352         } else {
01353                 return insert(rec);
01354         }
01355 
01356 }
01357 
01358 // This method finds the record following the one at the
01359 // location given as locn, and copies the record into rec.
01360 // The direction can be either forward or backward.
01361 template<typename KeyType, typename ValueType, typename LockType,
01362                 typename Alloc> bool BTreeFile< KeyType, ValueType, LockType, Alloc>::seq(
01363                 SDBCursor& locn, DataType& rec, ESeqDirection sdir) {
01364         switch (sdir) {
01365         case ESD_FORWARD:
01366                 return _seqNext(locn, rec);
01367 
01368         case ESD_BACKWARD:
01369                 return _seqPrev(locn, rec);
01370         }
01371 
01372         return false;
01373 }
01374 
01375 // Find the next item in the database given a location. Return
01376 // the subsequent item in rec.
01377 template<typename KeyType, typename ValueType, typename LockType,
01378                 typename Alloc> bool BTreeFile< KeyType, ValueType, LockType, Alloc>::_seqNext(
01379                 SDBCursor& locn, DataType& rec) {
01380         // Set up a couple of convenience values
01381         bool ret = false;
01382         BTreeNodePtr node = locn.first;
01383         size_t lastPos = locn.second;
01384         bool goUp = false; // indicates whether or not we've exhausted a node.
01385 
01386         // If we are starting at the beginning, initialise
01387         // the locn reference and return with the value set.
01388         // This means we have to plunge into the depths of the
01389         // tree to find the first leaf node.
01390         if ((BTreeNodePtr)node == 0) {
01391                 node = _root;
01392                 while ((BTreeNodePtr)node != 0 && !node->isLeaf) {
01393                         node = node->loadChild(0, _dataFile);
01395                 }
01396                 if ((BTreeNodePtr)node == 0) {
01397                         return false;
01398                 }
01399                 rec = *(node->elements[0]->pdat);
01400                 locn.first = node;
01401                 locn.second = 0;
01402                 return true;
01403         }
01404 
01405         // Advance the locn object to the next item
01406 
01407         // If we have a leaf node, we don't need to worry about
01408         // traversing into children ... only need to worry about
01409         // going back up the tree.
01410         if (node->isLeaf) {
01411                 // didn't visit the last node last time.
01412                 if (lastPos < node->objCount - 1) {
01413                         rec = *(node->elements[lastPos + 1]->pdat);
01414                         locn.second = lastPos + 1;
01415                         return true;
01416                 }
01417                 goUp = (lastPos == node->objCount - 1);
01418         }
01419 
01420         // Not a leaf, therefore need to worry about traversing
01421         // into child nodes.
01422         else {
01423                 node = node->loadChild(lastPos + 1, _dataFile);//_cacheInsert(node);
01424                 while ((BTreeNodePtr)node != 0 && !node->isLeaf) {
01425                         node = node->loadChild(0, _dataFile);
01426                 }
01427                 if ((BTreeNodePtr)node == 0) {
01428                         return false;
01429                 }
01430                 rec = *(node->elements[0]->pdat);
01431                 locn.first = node;
01432                 locn.second = 0;
01433                 return true;
01434         }
01435 
01436         // Finished off a leaf, therefore need to go up to
01437         // a parent.
01438         if (goUp) {
01439                 size_t childNo = node->childNo;
01440                 node = node->parent;
01441                 while ((BTreeNodePtr)node != 0 && childNo >= node->objCount) {
01442                         childNo = node->childNo;
01443                         node = node->parent;
01444                 }
01445                 if ((BTreeNodePtr)node != 0) {
01446                         locn.first = node;
01447                         locn.second = childNo;
01448                         ret = true;
01449                         rec = *(node->elements[childNo]->pdat);
01450                 }
01451         }
01452         return ret;
01453 }
01454 
01455 // Find the previous item in the database given a location. Return
01456 // the item in rec.
01457 template<typename KeyType, typename ValueType, typename LockType,
01458                 typename Alloc> bool BTreeFile< KeyType, ValueType, LockType, Alloc>::_seqPrev(
01459                 SDBCursor& locn, DataType& rec) {
01460         // Set up a couple of convenience values
01461 
01462         bool ret = false;
01463         BTreeNodePtr node = locn.first;
01464         size_t lastPos = locn.second;
01465         bool goUp = false; // indicates whether or not we've exhausted a node.
01466 
01467 
01468         // If we are starting at the end, initialise
01469         // the locn reference and return with the value set.
01470         // This means we have to plunge into the depths of the
01471         // tree to find the first leaf node.
01472 
01473         if ((BTreeNodePtr)node == 0) {
01474                 node = _root;
01475                 while ((BTreeNodePtr)node != 0 && !node->isLeaf) {
01476                         node = node->loadChild(node->objCount, _dataFile);
01477                 }
01478                 if ((BTreeNodePtr)node == 0) {
01479 
01480                         return false;
01481                 }
01482                 locn.first = node;
01483                 locn.second = node->objCount - 1;
01484 
01485                 if (locn.second == size_t(-1) )
01486                         return false;
01487                 rec = *(node->elements[locn.second]->pdat);
01488                 return true;
01489         }
01490 
01491         // Advance the locn object to the next item
01492 
01493         // If we have a leaf node, we don't need to worry about
01494         // traversing into children ... only need to worry about
01495         // going back up the tree.
01496         if (node->isLeaf) {
01497                 // didn't visit the last node last time.
01498                 if (lastPos> 0) {
01499                         locn.second = lastPos - 1;
01500                         rec = *(node->elements[locn.second]->pdat);
01501                         return true;
01502                 }
01503                 goUp = (lastPos == 0);
01504         }
01505 
01506         // Not a leaf, therefore need to worry about traversing
01507         // into child nodes.
01508         else {
01509                 node = node->loadChild(lastPos, _dataFile);
01510                 while ((BTreeNodePtr)node != 0 && !node->isLeaf) {
01511                         node = node->loadChild(node->objCount, _dataFile);
01512                 }
01513                 if ((BTreeNodePtr)node == 0) {
01514 
01515                         return false;
01516                 }
01517                 locn.first = node;
01518                 locn.second = node->objCount - 1;
01519                 rec = *(node->elements[locn.second]->pdat);
01520                 return true;
01521         }
01522 
01523         // Finished off a leaf, therefore need to go up to
01524         // a parent.
01525         if (goUp) {
01526                 size_t childNo = node->childNo;
01527                 node = node->parent;
01528 
01529                 while ((BTreeNodePtr)node != 0 && childNo == 0) {
01530                         childNo = node->childNo;
01531                         node = node->parent;
01532                 }
01533                 if ((BTreeNodePtr)node != 0) {
01534                         locn.first = node;
01535                         locn.second = childNo - 1;
01536                         rec = *(node->elements[locn.second]->pdat);
01537                         ret = true;
01538                 }
01539         }
01540         return ret;
01541 }
01542 
01543 // This method flushes all loaded nodes to the file and
01544 // then unloads the root node' children. So not only do we commit
01545 // everything to file, we also free up most memory previously
01546 // allocated.
01547 template<typename KeyType, typename ValueType, typename LockType,
01548                 typename Alloc> void BTreeFile< KeyType, ValueType, LockType, Alloc>::flush() {
01549 
01550         //write back the fileHead and dirtypage
01551         commit();
01552         // Unload each of the root's childrent. 
01553         if (_root && !_root->isLeaf) {
01554                 for (size_t ctr = 0; ctr <= _root->objCount; ctr++) {
01555 
01556                         BTreeNodePtr pChild = _root->children[ctr];
01557                         if ((BTreeNodePtr)pChild != 0) {
01558                                 _root->children[ctr]->unload();
01559                         }
01560                         _isUnload = false;
01561 
01562                 }
01563         }
01564 }
01565

01567 #endif /*BTREEFILE_H_*/
